quote: I'm a great believer in karma, and the vengeance that it serves up to those who are deliberately mean is generally enough for me.
More than an actor, I am a performer... I'm a great believer - honestly so, shamelessly so, vulgarly so - that cinema is for entertainment. If you want to send messages, there's the postal service.
I'm a great believer in spontaneity because I think planning is the most destructive thing in the world.
I'm a great believer in the idea that if it's meant to be, it will be.

I have always been a great believer that women should support women, and my admiration goes out to mothers everywhere, as they constantly put their own needs behind those of their children, embracing daily uncertainties and entering the new uncharted territories that each day brings, to be, in return, rewarded with joy and unending love.
I am a great believer in jobs for teens. They teach important life lessons, build character, and inflict just the right amount of humiliation necessary for future success in the working world.
I'm a great believer that the Lord provides us specific experiences to prepare us to deal with some of the challenges that we're going to encounter in our own period of service.
I'm a great believer in fate. I think things happen in spite of, and despite, yourself.
I'm a great believer in research. I have to know about a place before I write a story that is set in that place.

I'm a great believer that the most important years are the sort of early years but the preschool years and then into the first and second grades. If you get a good base in the first and second grade and you can read, you can do anything.
I'm an incurable optimist, and I'm a great believer in never looking back. Life is too short, and new challenges are exciting.

I'm a great believer that any tool that enhances communication has profound effects in terms of how people can learn from each other, and how they can achieve the kind of freedoms that they're interested in.
I'm a great believer in poetry out of the classroom, in public places, on subways, trains, on cocktail napkins. I'd rather have my poems on the subway than around the seminar table at an MFA program.

I'm a practical person. Most fashion people live in the clouds, and they're full of it. I live like a human being - or, I try to - and I have to be intelligent; I have to be practical. I'm a great believer in common sense, and the older I get, I see that common sense is not that common.
I'm a great believer in the character of a club. To me, character has a lot to do with how you compete. That creates urgency and toughness. That elevates the talent that you have.
What's most important in animation is the emotions and the ideas being portrayed. I'm a great believer of energy and emotion.
I'm a great believer in the direct quote in quotation marks and the hard fact.
I'm a great believer in geography being destiny.
I'm a great believer in possibilities.

I'm a great believer in chaos. I don't believe that you start with a formula and then you fulfill the formula. Chaos is a much better instigator, because we live in chaos - we don't live in a rigorous form.
Life is precious and relationships are precious. I'm a great believer in family.
I'm not a great believer in self-help.
I am a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
Oh, I'm a great believer in the power of the pause. Radio is a bit brasher now. My style was slower. I just used to go in, open the microphone and say the first thing that came into my head.

I've always been a great believer that you have to keep producing new things in order to keep life interesting - not only for ourselves, but for the audience as well. That's really always been our principle and way of working.
I am a great believer in Indian entrepreneurship. There is a whole set of people doing so many exciting things.
I'm a great believer in gathering together all your obsessions and seeing if you can make a novel out of them.
I am a great believer in found families and I'm not a great believer in blood.
I'm a great believer that you had to do everything you've done to have got to where you are.
I'm a great believer in outlines.
I'm a great believer in letting lyrics just flow out, wherever they come from.
I'm not a great believer in marriages as an institution, or even in very long term relationships. I'm not sure we're built that way.
I'm a great believer in eccentrically-shaped modern families. Because I've seen them work so well. And as long as everyone loves each other, it can work very well.
I'm a great believer in stunt doubles. They do an amazing job.
No I'm not a great believer in getting back over things and saying if only, or if, or buts because I don't think we actually get anywhere on that.
I'm a great believer in not sitting around waiting for the right part to come around, but jumping in and building it for yourself.
I'm a great believer in giving people a chance.
I am a great believer that a captain is as good as his team.

I grew up in Brooklyn, N.Y., and I'm a great believer that you can't have too conservative a President nor too liberal a Supreme Court. So I'm a walking contradiction. I believe that you should try to really protect people's rights in every way, and also, people should be allowed to do what they do.
I've done a number of things based on real people or true stories or based on books, and I'm a great believer that you have to be true to the script.

My children receive education that greatly emphasizes the fact they are part of a human group that has tradition, collective memory, and a state. I am a great believer in the need for Israel to be a Jewish state. I certainly believe my children will pass that on to their children.

I'm a great believer that actors are very similar to session musicians. You wouldn't ask a session musician, 'How do you play jazz,' and then, 'How do you play classical?' They just do it, because if they don't do it, they don't eat.

You start realizing that good prose is crunchy. There's texture in your mouth as you say it. You realize bad writing, bland writing, has no texture, no taste, no corners in your mouth. I'm a great believer in reading aloud.

I'm a great believer in governments doing as little as possible and people power doing the rest, so I'm in favour of governments being there to govern in the areas that need governing, not a whole heap of other things that they stick their sticky fingers into.
I am not a great believer in the idea that journalistic neutrality means you have to abandon the people you talk to.
Being a great believer in Scottish tradition, I followed the example of my fellow countrymen and moved to England.
I have set up several businesses as social businesses, and I am a great believer that the power of business should be used for good.
I'm a great believer in not over-thinking lyrics. You might become technically better as a songwriter, but you lose what originally made your songs great.
I'm not like my siblings, who are musical but can turn their hands to other professions! I'd always wanted to be involved in music - I'm a great believer in doing things that fulfil you.
I am a great believer in having the power to end your life and knowing that, in extremis, you can. But I would not want to involve anybody else in my actions if it could imperil them.
I'm a great believer in the novelist being 'on the scene,' reporting, traveling, meeting all sorts of people.

I'm not much given to making shamanistic remarks about all this, but I'm a great believer in the dream life. If I can carry without spilling whatever it is that drips into my head in the night to my desk, then that's valuable.
I'm also a great believer in the dream life; that while we're asleep, a deep subconscious connection is made about our profoundest fears, hopes, loves, losses, dreads and desires.
I'm a great believer that scientists should spend as much time as possible explaining, and you do explain in the process of teaching.

I'm a great believer in our ability to come up with the ideas necessary to solve the big questions. I have less confidence that we'll be able to find a consensus about which ones are right without experiment.
Yes, a Major would mean so much to me but I'm a great believer that if you work hard and in the right way, you will get what you deserve.
I'm a great believer in the beauty and the power of surprise.
I am a great believer that your humor is developed at a very early age, and it doesn't ever change. You're basically the same person forever, so you find the same stuff funny forever.
I'm not a great believer in awards-of course the fact that I've never won one has nothing to do with it at all!
I'm a great believer in the competitive system, and think that competition will bring us greater innovation and put American industry in information ahead of everyone also.
I am a great believer in luck.
I am a great believer that what makes our show different is the humor.
I plant a lot of trees. I am a great believer in planting things for future generations. I loathe the now culture where you just live for today.

I am a great believer in the OHIO principle: Only handle it once. When you read an e-mail, decide whether or not to reply to it, and, if you need to reply, do so right then and there. I have found that about 80 percent of all e-mails, whether internal or external, do not require a response.
The resilience of these people is amazing. I am a great believer that the sooner we get things up and running in terms of sport in this area, the better.
I'm a great believer in the idea of not choosing based on our taste.
I am a great believer in people taking control of their own lives.
I'm a great believer in the experiential theory of writing.
If I don't get eight hours, I can't function, so I'm a great believer in power naps.
I am a great believer in naps, whatever age you are.

Whatever part I'm playing, I always carry with me something that's been used by an illustrious predecessor. I'm a great believer in a touching of hands. I have daggers belonging to Henry Irving and Sarah Siddons.
Yes, I'm a great believer in angels.
I'd rather win two or three, lose one, win two or three more. I'm a great believer in things evening out. If you win a whole bunch in a row, somewhere along the line you're going to lose some too.
I'm a great believer in people and their untapped potential.
